item.description:
I am determined to see this concert!   

There are a LIMITED number of lower-priced tickets, so ACT QUICKLY! 
First come, first served! Ticket price is $41 - this includes all fees. 
SEE BELOW FOR PAYMENT INFO>>>

Ravel, Salonen and Stravinsky - Boston Symphony Orchestra

Former Los Angeles Philharmonic music director Esa-Pekka Salonen makes a long-awaited return to the BSO podium with a sparkling program, including a recent work of his own, the highly admired Violin Concerto. The critically acclaimed and popular Canadian-born virtuoso Leila Josefowicz, for whom Salonen wrote the piece, is soloist in these performances. Ravel's familiar Le Tombeau de Couperin is the composer's own orchestration of four movements from his 1917 piano suite of the same name. Stravinsky's complete The Firebird ballet score, composed in 1910 for the Ballets Russes, launched the composer's international reputation with its kaleidoscopic orchestration and exotic sound. It remains one of his most popular works.

I am going to order these tickets SUNDAY NIGHT...yes, tomorrow! 
As soon as I have 6 people PAID...I will go on line and order!  Seats are in the front part of the second balcony, on the side.


PAYMENT INFO! 
Please send $41 via PayPal to me using this email: julie.chilton@yahoo.com.

IMPORTANT! 
When you pay with Paypal, please click the tab that says "Personal" and where it says "This money is being sent as" click on "payment owed."  

I am going to be ordering the tickets THIS SUNDAY EVENING, FEBRUARY 5.   I will only order for people who have paid! So if you'd like to come to this concert, please RSVP and pay as soon as possible!

This event is cross-posted with The Gang of Gadabouts

Boston Symphony Hall is one of the finest concerts halls in the world!
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet up for an early dinner before the concert!
item.name: Stravinsky's Firebird at the BSO - LIMITED TIME!
